intro: Scutia colombiana, commonly known as Colombian scutia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its root system is known for containing bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine. Scutia colombiana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by supporting local biodiversity.
